posts.post_content:
You forget that in this block many powerful black-red cards exist, and given the wide assortment of sources of direct damage that red has, this card seems like a good combination.  
  
Also, you assume Corrupt will always deal at least 6 points of damage. Again, in a B/R deck, assuming an equal number of Mountains and Swamps, Corrupt would statistically be more likely to deal only 3 damage. Instead, a Fireball would effectively do 10 damage for the same mana cost. And, since you're playing B/R maybe a Breath of Malfegor to make everyone hate you. Of course there are more ways to deal with an enchantment, but the same fact it is one means that if they don't do something about it fast, you'll get the same effect not just during your turns but on every end step. Corrupt, obviously, will only work once.  
  
In comparison to the other Reflection Enchantments from Shadowmoor, this one is the only one that has an effect on opponents instead of yourself. Again, under the assumption B/R is being playe... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
In normal 1vs1 games, this card plain sucks. Just compare it to [Corrupt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corrupt).   
  
Corrupt:  
- deals about 6 damage right when you play it  
- gains you life  
- can also kill creatures  
  
Wound Reflection:  
- does nothing by itself when you play it  
- is unlike corrupt vulnerable to bounce and cards that destroy or steal enchantments  
- cant kill creatures  
- doesnt gain you life  
- you have to deal at least 6 damage to your opponent, before this card deals the same damage as corrupt  
- you must have other permanents in play to deal damage (if they are creatures, they must be able to attack, be unblocked and deal a reasonable amount of damage). Else, you have to wait a turn until you have mana again to play some spells to deal damage  
  
In multiplayer games where you start with 40 life, this card might make sense (but also will make everyone attack you). In 1vs1, it's plain useless. Horrible card. I'd never play it. Sounds fun if you think "Oooooh double damage!" but it is really reall... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

- is unlike corrupt vulnerable to bounce and cards that destroy or steal enchantments
- cant kill creatures
- doesnt gain you life
- you have to deal at least 6 damage to your opponent, before this card deals the same damage as corrupt
- you must have other permanents in play to deal damage (if they are creatures, they must be able to attack, be unblocked and deal a reasonable amount of damage). Else, you have to wait a turn until you have mana again to play some spells to deal damage

In multiplayer games where you start with 40 life, this card might make sense (but also will make everyone attack you). In 1vs1, it's plain useless. Horrible card. I'd never play it. Sounds fun if you think "Oooooh double damage!" but it is really reall... (see all)

posts.post_content:
The crazy thing is, you can play this card in your second main phase and it still does its job.  
  
So, let's say you dealt ten combat damage to your opponent, because they decided that they could take the damage, drop to 10 life, and then kill you on their turn.  
  
Surprise! Another 10 life lost at the end of your turn after dropping this card. And you can then proceed to start killing your other opponents with both a 2-to-1 damage ratio and their awed respect.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@ Faildini: Check the rulings of [Repay in Kind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Repay in Kind). It says that the players actually gain or lose life to make the life totals equal, and that it will interact with cards that deal with loss of life.  
  
Pretty awesome card in general. Any good Pain-draw or R/B burn could use this to some effect.
posts.html:
@ Faildini: Check the rulings of Repay in Kind. It says that the players actually gain or lose life to make the life totals equal, and that it will interact with cards that deal with loss of life.

Pretty awesome card in general. Any good Pain-draw or R/B burn could use this to some effect.

posts.post_content: Things like [Repay in Kind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Repay in Kind) wouldn't actually work with this card, since they simply change your opponent's life total instead of causing them to lose life. Still a sweet card, especially in a B/R deck: [Pestilence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence)/[Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia), red burn spells, etc. 4/5 for being a bit pricey
posts.html:
